description: a(n) is the least prime p such that p-1 is divisible by 2^n and not by 2^(n+1).
comments: If we drop the requirement that p-1 must not be divisible by 2^(n+1), we get instead A035089, which is a nondecreasing sequence. - _Jeppe Stig Nielsen_, Aug 09 2015
links: Donovan Johnson, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
example: a(13) = 40961 = 1 + 8192*5 where the last term is divisible by the 13th power of 2 and 40961 is the smallest prime with that property.
maple: f:= proc(n) local p;  for p from 2^n+1 by 2^(n+1) do    if isprime(p) then return p fi  odend proc:map(f, [$0..100]); # _Robert Israel_, Aug 10 2015
mathematica: Table[k = 1; While[p = k*2^n + 1; ! PrimeQ[p], k = k + 2]; p, {n, 0, 40}] (* _T. D. Noe_, Dec 27 2011 *)
author: _Labos Elemer_, Nov 02 2000
extensions: More terms from Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), Nov 03 2000
